fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36738].
  {panel}

*Background of Request*

Confluence 5.7 introduce a new feature where it is able to preview attachments as can be seen [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+5.7+Release+Notes#Confluence5.7ReleaseNotes-Filesarefirstclasscitizens]. One of the feature available is to covert a thumbnail of attachment into a link with "Show as link" button.

However, once the attachment is converted into a link it is not possible to convert it back to thumbnail. This is because "Show as Thumbnail" button is not available for "Linking" even if it is a link of an attachment.

*Possible Implementation*

Confluence "Linking" feature should be able to differentiate attachment link and URL link. From there, Confluence able to provide "Show as thumbnail" button only for attachment link.
fields.summary: "Show as Thumbnail" Button is not Available for Attachment Link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36736].
{panel}
h4. Problem

Attachment preview is enabled automatically for attachment files within Confluence. This is unsupported on some browsers and for some users is an undesired response when clicking on an attachment.
h4. Suggestion
 * Disable preview for certain file extensions - See CONFSERVER-36899
 * Disable preview for certain spaces
 * Tell Confluence how to handle opening certain extensions
 * Disable entirely for the instance - Workaround, disable the *_Confluence Previews_* plugin as per [Community post|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Is-there-a-way-to-turn-off-the-quot-preview-quot-feature-and/qaq-p/201649]
* Disable by user (preferably so the user can toggle preview functionality via a profile setting without admin permissions)
* Disable previews for Confluence search results [for attachments when clicked on, resulting out of Confluence search results]
fields.summary: Selectively Disable Attachment Preview

fields.description:
The fix for CONF-24035 hard-codes SSLv3 and TLSv1 protocols and explicitly retries with SSLv3 which is not needed. The SSLv3 communication problem in java & confluence is actually caused by java changing its 'client_version' in the TLS handshake. This can be fixed by setting the ' com.sun.net.ssl.rsaPreMasterSecretFix' system property to 'true' or by enabling TLSv1.1 or higher (in java 7+). See https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/SAL-280 & https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/SAL-299.

I suggest that this issue be fixed by updating SAL and using the httpclient SAL provides instead of creating a new instance. Note: because of [SAL-300|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/SAL-300] if confluence wants to support SSLv3 then it will need to set the {{https.protocols}} system property to one that contains SSLv3. We suggest not enabling SSLv3 as it is an old and insecure protocol.
fields.summary: The fix for CONF-24035 hard-codes SSLv3 and TLSv1 protocols and explicitly retries with SSLv3 which is not needed

fields.description:
When using the code block macro and export to PDF, the PDF generated has unexpected white space when the code block is just past the page limit.

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Create an empty page and add code block macro.
# Insert block of code into the macro 45 lines long.
# Save page.
# Export page to PDF

h3. Expected behavior
Expected PDF file to display block of code continuously and extend into next page without any white space.

h3. Actual behavior
The PDF contains the code block on the first page. Second page contains one line of code and then white space. The rest of code appears on the third page. 

h3. Related Notes
* Location of where white space generated is dependent on the lines of code in the block. It can sometimes appear at the front or the back. With 42 lines of code, a page break is generated for the first page and the code appears on the second page.
* Also affects no format macro and panel macro.
fields.summary: Excessive Whitespace Occurs When Exporting Pages to PDF with Code Macro Elements

fields.description:
h6. Situation
When a table is copied, it will lose its table formatting then pasted. The outcome will only be the texts inside the table.

h6. Steps to reproduce/environment where bug is observed:
In *Confluence 5.7* , while using *Firefox 36* browser, have a page with *several layouts*. Create a table in this page, and then try to copy the table to another location.

h6. What is expected
Copied normally

h6. What actually happens (behavior observed are either the following):
* Only the text inside the table is copied. Seems like it has lost its table formatting
* Nothing is copied

h6. Workaround:
It seems like while selecting the table, selecting the line before and after the table before copying (instead of just selecting the table) will help to avoid encounter this issue.

h6. More information, (including the workaround) please watch the screencast attached
fields.summary: Issues With Copying and Pasting Table in Confluence 5.7

In some cases, the home page set for Confluence might not render well in a mobile browser. In cases like this, it would be beneficial for a Confluence Admin to be able to either have the Desktop version be the default (and offer the option to view in mobile) or set a different home page for mobile browsers entirely.

fields.description:
When there is a comment for a file which is attached to a restricted page, all users can see the comment, even the ones who are not allowed to see the page and its attachments.

h3. Workaround for 5.7

There is no workaround for customers running Confluence 5.7. Customers are advised to upgrade to Confluence 5.7.1.

h3. Workaround for 5.7.1

While the problem is fixed in Confluence 5.7.1, file annotations that were created prior to 5.7.1 will continue to show on the dashboard and in search. The workaround is to reindex the instance using the "Content Indexing" admin page.
fields.summary: Restrictions not applied for inline comments in attachments

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36701].
  {panel}

h6. Current Situation:
Users with username set as characters unrelated to their name are not able to be searched using their username

Example: 
# User "John Doe" has the username: "j1234"
# By typing "j1234" in the search field will not return anything

h6. What Should be Implemented:
Be able to search users by their username

Example: 
By typing "j1234" in the search field will not return John Doe's profile

h6. Current Workaround:
Append 'username:' before their username in the search field
Example:
{code}
username:j1234
{code}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36698].
  {panel}

Multibyte characters ( like Japanese or Chinese ) does not get rendered in Confluence Cloud

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Upload Office file which contains Japanese characters to a page in Confluence. 
# Click on the document (See attached capture.jpg)

h4. Actual results
Japanese characters are displayed as squares.

h4. Findings 
The problem could be solved by the following knowledge base if it were Confluence Server (not Confluence Cloud).
- [Non-ASCII Characters display as Square Characters in Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Non-ASCII+Characters+display+as+Square+Characters+in+Confluence]

The knowledge base article tells the problem could be solved by installing proper font files to both OS and JVM. It seems the OS of Confluence Cloud already has proper font files installed, however, JVM is not. Users cannot install font files to JVM because the instance is Confluence Cloud (not Confluence Server).

h4. Workaround
- Use Office macro instead (See attached capture.jpg)

h4. Notes
- [CONF-36557|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36557] is similar problem but it is different. The cause of this problem is that font files cannot be installed to JVM of Confluence Cloud, while the cause of [CONF-36557|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-36557] is that the solution of the knowledge base does not work only when using Excel spreadsheet even after installing font files to JVM of Confluence Server.
fields.summary: Multibyte characters in Office Preview don't get rendered in Confluence Cloud because font files cannot be installed to JVM

fields.description:
The heartbeat actions sent from the editor attempt to obtain a lock to do it's work. However it waits forever on that lock - so multiple heartbeats start to build up, eating up HTTP threads.

The action should only wait on the lock as long as the heartbeat interval.
fields.summary: Editor Heartbeat action should not wait forever on lock

h6. Current Issue:
* Image previews have a lower resolution than the actual file 
* Clicking the attachment to view it in the new file viewer renders the attachment in its proper resolution

h6. How to Reproduce:
* Add a high resolution attachment (PDF or image) to a page using the new file insertion feature (Edit page > Insert files and images)
* Save and review the page

h6. Expected Result:
* The preview image retains the same resolution as the actual file 

h6. Actual Result
* The preview image is of a lower resolution and can appear blurry (see screenshot)
fields.summary: Improve resolution on PDF images using Attachments macro.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36692].
  {panel}

Confluence 5.7 released with a whole new powerful image previewer.  Currently there is no way for you to access the preview tool from the View PDF Macro. You need to have another image embedded onto the site to access the preview option. Then navigate to the PDF this way.

h6. Steps to Reproduce:
- Place a PDF into a page via View PDF Macro.
- There is a option to full screen but never places you in new preview mode.
!PDF macro general Viewer.png|thumbnail!


h6. Current Work Around #1:
- Attach the PDF as an attachment on the site.
- Since it is detected as an attachment the new image previewer will work.
- The Resolution suffers heavily with this macro
!Attachment Macro.png|thumbnail!

h6. Current Work Around #2:
- Place a PDF onto a page.
- Have an image on the same page as the PDF
- Click on the image to load new image preview
- There are arrow toggles to move to the next file.
- Toggle the arrows until PDF is reached.
- The Attached PDF now can be seen via the attachment viewer.
!View PDF Macro With Image.png|thumbnail!
!After Click on Image able to view PDF with new viewer.png|thumbnail!

h6. Desired  Results
- View PDF Macro should allow you to go into new Image preview.
- New Image preview should have a sub set of navigation arrows for PDF page navigation instead of general image navigation.
fields.summary: New Image Previewer does not Auto Render for PDF-Macro.

Currently, when we have a Gliffy diagram, when we search for it using Confluence search, the link takes us to a page full of text, instead of a view of the diagram.

This is illustrated below:

We can create a diagram in a page and see it in the attachments. The link shown takes us to the diagram:
!link_to_diagram.png|thumbnail!

This is what we see:
!diagram.png|thumbnail!

However, if I search for the diagram:
!search.png|thumbnail!

The link to the attachment is there, as well as to the page and the generated image. However, if I open the attachment, I get:
!text_diagram.png|thumbnail!

Text describing the diagram, instead of the fancy page where I can modify it. 

That is confusing, as the users can't find the diagram page using searches. The '.png' link shows me the diagram, it is the image generated by Gliffy for the diagram. However, I cannot use it to edit the diagram, as it is only an image and it's confusing.

Adding the link to the page where I can edit the diagram (first image) would be much easier and less confusing.
fields.summary: Show different links for Gliffy diagrams in searches

fields.description:
*Bug Background*

Confluence {{super-users}} or member of {{confluence-administrators}} group should be able to access any content in Confluence including restricted content as long as it have the direct URL to access as describe in our documentation [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Global+Permissions+Overview#GlobalPermissionsOverview-Comparingtheconfluence-administratorsgroupwiththeadministratorpermissions]

{quote}
The 'confluence-administrators' group defines a set of 'super-users' who can access the Confluence administration console and perform site-wide administration. Members of this group can also see the content of all pages and spaces in the Confluence instance, regardless of space permissions. They cannot immediately see the pages that exclude them via page restrictions without knowing the direct URL to the page. They can remove the page restrictions via the Space Administration screen if need be. For example, they will not see restricted pages displayed by the children macro. But they are able to access restricted pages directly using the page URL.{quote}

The above documentation confirm that {{super-users}} should follow the following points:

# See all content of all pages and spaces in the Confluence instance.
# *They cannot immediately see the pages that exclude them via page restrictions without knowing the direct URL to the page*.
#* For example, they will not see restricted pages displayed by the children macro. But they are able to access restricted pages directly using the page URL.
# They can remove the page restrictions via the Space Administration screen if need be.

The second point clearly describe that Confluence {{super-users}} can only access restricted page only through direct URL and no other method. We have confirmed that the following feature won't reveal restricted page to {{super-users}}

* Search function
* Recently-updated macro
* Children Macro

However the following features does not hide the restricted page as describe in the following screenshots:

In this scenario, *Restricted* page is restricted for all user except for one user. However the following features still provide the link to this page to {{super-users}}

* Navigation Panel in Default Theme
!navigation.png|thumbnail!
* Page Tree
!pagetree.png!
* Quick Search
!quicksearch.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Member of confluence-administrators group able to see restricted page in pagetree, quick search and navigation panel

fields.description:
The following issues pertain to the use of the confluence plugin that inserts an interactive Microsoft Powerpoint presentation into the page.

1) Numbered lists
Numbered lists in powerpoint appear as bullets when embedded in the page.

2) Font Resizing
Font size is enlarged from original.  This causes text to appear in a different location when compared to say a background template image and can cause text to wrap onto multiple lines, when it originally displays within the same line.  The text wrapping contributes to the phenomenon where lines of text are cut off and not displayed when the presentation is embedded in the page.

Note: I spot checked a handful of font faces (including the default theme fonts) and sizes  varying from 12 to 32 and the font size was enlarged regardless of my selection.

3) Dimensions
Unless you either a) set the powerpoint page setup to use a custom width of 10 inches and a height of 8 inches or b) explicitly set the macro properties for height and width accordingly, the embedded image will be resized with different ratio dimensions, resulting in grey matting above, below, to the left, and or to the right of your presentation.  This may also exacerbate the cropping issue where partial text appears on the screen.

Note: Why hard code the macro to change the default ratio of the presentation versus preserving the ratio?  If a default ratio must be set and not at 100% by 100%, then consider the fact that Microsoft defaults the on screen ratio of 4:3 to 10 by 7.5 inches.

4) Fullscreen Cropping
Switching to the fullscreen mode crops additional portions of the text that would otherwise appear.

See attached for an example powerpoint and resulting screenshots that exhibits these issues.

Note: The second issue is similar to https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-28606, but I wasn't sure if we were reporting the same issue or even talking about the same macro.
fields.summary: Office Powerpoint Macro Formatting Issues

  {panel}

The Roadmap Planner Macro bundled into Confluence 5.7 is great, but it could be truly amazing if it were able to pull the data for lanes, bars, and markers from an external source.

At minimum, it would be useful to use a linked JIRA instance as a source for roadmap data, but it would be extremely valuable if this were pluggable in some way so that teams could implement alternative data sources (such as other databases that provide planning information).

Ideally, this capability would allow a single query to provide all the required data (i.e. parsing attributes from the query, mapped to "Lane", "Start Date", "End Date"), but it might also be useful to define separate queries for each lane, allowing for planning data to be amalgamated onto a roadmap.  Markers might always require a separate query as well.

An enhancement like this would provide an amazing visualization capability for planning purposes, rather than requiring someone to manually propagate changes in a planning database to the roadmap diagram.
fields.summary: Enable Roadmap Planner Macro to pull data from an external source

fields.description:
When an attachment type is "pdf" instead of "application/pdf" added to Confluence page as Link > Attachments, upgrading the instance to version 5.7 will not allow that Link to be previewed with the File Preview feature.

*Steps to replicate*
# Run Confluence version prior to 5.7 (e.g. 5.6.3)
# Create a new page and click Link > Attachments, then insert a PDF file (e.g: with the name "Test.pdf")
# Save the page
# Go to Tools >> Attachments, then click 'Properties' link on the "Test.pdf"
# Modify 'New Content Type' from {{application/pdf}} to {{pdf}}, and Save
# Upgrade Confluence to 5.7
# In that same page, click "Test.pdf" 

*Observation*
- The "Test.pdf" link is not displayed in File preview
- Inserting new Link > Attachments (e.g: "Test_2.pdf") in that page will allow the link "Test_2.pdf" to be displayed in File preview
- Prior to version 5.7, the CONTENTTYPE is stored in ATTACHMENTS table. In version 5.7, this information is migrated to CONTENTPROPERTIES table

*Workaround*
Run the following SQL query:
{code:sql}
update contentproperties set STRINGVAL = 'application/pdf' where PROPERTYNAME = 'MEDIA_TYPE' AND STRINGVAL = 'pdf';
{code}
[KB Article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Unable+to+Preview+PDF+Link+In+a+Page+After+Upgrade+to+5.7]
fields.summary: Unable to Preview PDF Attachment Link Due to Wrong MEDIA_TYPE After Upgrade

The new inline comments in Confluence 5.7 can only be turned off or on system-wide.
This is not sufficient.
I would like the ability to be able to turn inline comments on/off by space.
The reason is that we have different kind of spaces in our Confluence system. For some, the inline comments are great and very welcome (for example in spaces where we develop documentation collaboratively), but for others they are contra-productive. (for example in spaces where the final / released documentation is published)

We don't have the luxury to set up several confluence instance just for being able to manage them differently (like Atlassian does).
Therefore, please provide a space-specific configuration for this feature.

fields.description:
Yes, this is a duplicate of [CONF-32139], but it is because that issue was marked as Resolved because there was a desire not to delete pre-existing indexes. 

I think the proper resolution here is to do some checking in the upgrade task to determine if the index already exists and if so, use that index versus creating a new index. I know that SailPoint did this when we had many hundreds of clients running Oracle who added indexes for performance reasons through the Statistics and Query Analyser tools that improved performance in our application.  This made the upgrade tasks run smoothly to finish without upsetting the clients who had already added indexes by halting their upgrade tasks.

I would like to have this issue revisited as our largest clients are running Oracle backends and will see this issue in their environments. If we checked for the existence of an index on the table and column that we are about to index and then did not do so if it already exists, then the upgrade experience would be smoother overall.
fields.summary: Oracle Upgrade Fails due to pre-existing indexes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36651].
  {panel}

Usecase: 
We have a Confluence page that many people update many times each day. This is very useful and anyone can go to the page to check the latest. The problem is that it generates a lot of emails if it is watched.

The autowatch feature is great for "normal" pages, but for a "high traffic" page, it isn't very useful. This means that you have to either
1. Not use the autowatch feature, but then you have to remember to manually watch any  "non-high traffic" pages that you create, edit or watch, or
2. Use the autowatch feature, but remember to un-watch high traffic pages every time you edit one.

It would be great if I could define a black list of pages that I never want to be autowatched.
fields.summary: Blacklist of pages that should never be autowatched
Inline comments: ] does not toggle comment window to visible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36648].
  {panel}

h1. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup Confluence with URL: http://localhost:10570/confluence/
# Setup JIRA with URL: http://localhost:7315/jira/
# Setup Application Link between Confluence and Jira.
# Update Confluence with URL: http://localhost:8090/confluence/
# Update JIRA with URL: http://localhost:8091/jira/
# Update *Display URL* to http://localhost:8091/jira/ in the Confluence Application Link configuration.
!config.png|thumbnail!
# Create a JIRA Issue macro.
# Observe the links using browser developer tools.

h1. Expected Behaviour
JIRA issue macro should be rendered according to Display URL.

h1. Actual Behaviour
JIRA issue macro icon is rendered based on Application URL.
!tes1.png|thumbnail!
!test2.png|thumbnail!

h6. Note
The icon might not be rendered if *Display URL* is updated with Jira URL link that contains SSL (https) or proxy integration (redirection).
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro Icon Does Not Render According to Display URL
Add Inline Comments plugin to Confluence source code bundle

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36645].
  {panel}

The inline comments plugin shipped with Confluence 5.7 appears to have some service interfaces that would be useful to plugins: 
* _com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.inlinecomments.service.InlineCommentService_
* _com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.inlinecomments.service.ReplyCommentService_

But these are not exposed as OSGI public services.

If these classes are intended to form part of a plugin API this issue is to make them public and export the required packages at the OSGI level.  If these interfaces are intended to be internal this issue is about making a proper java api for this bundled plugin.
fields.summary: Inline comments java API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36641].
  {panel}

h3. Use Case
If there are a number of pages with similar titles or a number of attachments (for example images that follow IMG_1234 naming conventions), the search shows a limited number of results (2 in 5.7) but does not allow for wild card searches. 

If I were to want to search for anything that ended with 75, using the standard * for wildcard matches would find 0 results.

Searching the full Confluence instance with wildcard
!site_search.png|thumbnail!

Searching for links without wildcard
!no_wildcard.png|thumbnail!

Searching for links with wildcard in 5.7
!with_wildcard.png|thumbnail!

h3. Improvement
Add wildcard searches to the search box in the Link Macro, similar to the wildcards that are allowed in the regular site search.
fields.summary: Add Wildcards to Search Box for Insert Link Macro

# Install the Hipchat Integration Plugin

fields.description:
Some macros which are rendered as an image are not properly displayed in a HTML export of the space. They display a broken image or information about the macro.

Some others work as expected and the thumbnail image is added to the HTML export.

For example:
* The chart macro works as expected and the image is displayed in the HTML export.
* The view file renders as a broken image. Tested with a PDF file.
fields.summary: Thumbnails of macros not always exported in HTML export

fields.description:

The macro is rendered correctly if you restore the version of the page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36627].
  {panel}

Hi,

Detailed reproduction steps:
+Scenario1+
# Use a fresh install of JIRA and Confluence.
# Link applications(use Trusted applications), share user accounts.
# Create two projects.
# Create a wiki page. 
# Open the dialog to create a JIRA issue.
# In this dialog switching between projects should be fast.

+Scenario2+
# Create four more users in JIRA.
# Use German umlauts like "ü" in their full names.
# Reload and edit the wiki page.
# Open the dialog to create a JIRA issue.
# Switching between projects always takes a lot of time.


Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Creating JIRA issues from Confluence takes long time if user full name contains German umlauts

fields.description:
Confluence incorrectly reports the PermGen Space settings and usage in the System Information screen when running on Java 8

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Install Confluence 5.7 with Java 8 installed
# Goto Confluence Admin > System Information
# Scroll to Java VM Memory Statistics

h3. Expected behavior
Confluence will show the memory settings and usage, including percent of permgen used and min/max settings as shown in this screenshot running on Java 7
!permgen_java7.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual behavior
Confluence shows 100% free permgen space, with 0mb for min/max, as shown in this screenshot running on Java 8
!permgen_java8.png|thumbnail!

h3. Related Notes
* This only occurs when using Java 8, running Confluence 5.7 using Java 7 shows the permgen usage and settings as expected
fields.summary: PermGen Space Reported as 0mb in System Information Screen

The image from the Confluence Roadmap Plugin is broken and not displayed on Test page #2 using the Confluence Page Gadget (refer screenshot above) - The same thing occurs when you use the Confluence Page Gadget in JIRA.

*Expected Results:*
The image should be properly displayed and not broken.
